title: Update robot model to match real atlas

content.raw:
Now the real robot is available, it would be nice if the simulation matches the real robot. As far as we know, the weight of the simulated robot is in the ~90kg range while the real robot is around 150 kg. 

Parameters that should be based on the real robot include
* mass
* Center of mass locations
* inertia parameters
* friction coefficients
* joint limits
* actuator limits (torque - speed curve)

For model based controllers having the correct information is very important. When the competition started, there was talk of NIST validating the robot models, it would be nice if they can make proper measurements on a real Atlas instead of relying on the CAD models.
